Let me read the key files to understand this project better:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<results>
<output name="Read"># alignment-hive

Shared infrastructure for alignment researchers. [MATS](https://www.matsprogram.org/) scholars are the first intended users, but this is built for the broader AI safety community.

Large orgs benefit from shared tooling and accumulated knowledge across their agents. This project aims to bring some of those advantages to independent researchers:

- **Plugin marketplace** - Curated Claude Code plugins with skills for common research workflows
- **hive-mind** - A system for sharing session learnings across the community (in development)

## Installation

Add the marketplace to Claude Code:
```
/plugin marketplace add Crazytieguy/alignment-hive
```

Install the project-setup plugin (recommended for most users):
```
/plugin install project-setup@alignment-hive
```

It includes guidance on when to install other plugins from this marketplace.

## Contributing

The [plugin-dev](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code-plugins) plugin auto-installs when you clone this repo, so Claude can help with plugin development.

Feedback and suggestions welcomeâ€”open an issue, send a Slack DM, or reach out however works for you. All changes go through PR review.

## Roadmap

See [docs/roadmap.md](docs/roadmap.md) for what's planned.
</parameter>
</output>
</results>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/docs/roadmap.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<results>
<output name="Read"># Roadmap

## Now

### hive-mind v0.1

A system for sharing Claude Code session learnings across the AI safety community.

**How it works:**
- Contributors extract insights from their sessions using a local tool
- Insights are stored in a community-accessible location (details TBD - could be a GitHub repo, dedicated backend, or other solution)
- Anyone can query the accumulated knowledge for relevant guidance

**What makes a good insight:**
- Specific, actionable patterns (not generic advice)
- Includes context: what was being attempted, what worked/didn't
- Tool-specific discoveries (Claude Code behaviors, MCP patterns, etc.)
- Workarounds for common pitfalls

See session-8 for discussion of the JSONL format used to store insights.

## Later

- **More plugins** - Skills for common research workflows as patterns emerge
- **llms-txt plugin** - Auto-fetch llms.txt for dependencies and add to context
</parameter>
</output>
</results>

    },

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/hive-mind/README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<results>
<output name="Read"># hive-mind

Query and contribute to collective session learnings from the AI safety community.

## Commands

### Query
Search the knowledge base for relevant insights:
```
/hive-mind-query [search terms]
```

### Contribute
After a productive session, contribute learnings:
```
/hive-mind-contribute
```
This will analyze your session transcript and extract insights for the community.

## Development

The plugin is implemented in TypeScript. To build:

```bash
cd plugins/hive-mind
npm install
npm run build
```

The compiled JavaScript files will be in the same directory.
</parameter>
</output>
</results>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/hive-mind/hive-mind.ts</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<results>
<output name="Read">// Main plugin file that registers hooks and commands
import type { Plugin } from "@anthropic-ai/claude-code-sdk";

const plugin: Plugin = {
  name: "hive-mind",
  version: "0.1.0",
  description:
    "Query and contribute to collective session learnings from the AI safety community.",
};

export default plugin;
</parameter>
</output>
</results>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/hive-mind/hive-mind-query.ts</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<results>
<output name="Read">import type { CommandModule } from "@anthropic-ai/claude-code-sdk";

const command: CommandModule = {
  name: "hive-mind-query",
  description: "Search the knowledge base for relevant insights",
  async execute(_args: string[], _context) {
    return {
      message: `
hive-mind-query is not yet implemented.

For now, you can read the accumulated insights directly:
- docs/sessions/all-sessions.jsonl - Machine-readable insights from all sessions
- docs/sessions/session-*.md - Human-readable session documentation
      `.trim(),
    };
  },
};

export default command;
</parameter>
</output>
</results>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/hive-mind/hive-mind-contribute.ts</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<results>
<output name="Read">import type { CommandModule } from "@anthropic-ai/claude-code-sdk";

const command: CommandModule = {
  name: "hive-mind-contribute",
  description: "Contribute session learnings to the community knowledge base",
  async execute(_args: string[], _context) {
    return {
      message: `
hive-mind-contribute is not yet implemented.

For now, contributions are made through PRs to the alignment-hive repo:
1. Add insights to docs/sessions/all-sessions.jsonl
2. Optionally add detailed session notes to docs/sessions/session-N.md
3. Submit a PR for review
      `.trim(),
    };
  },
};

export default command;
</parameter>
</output>
</results>

</invoke>
</function_calls>
<results>
<output name="Read">{"insight": "Claude Code's TodoWrite tool doesn't actually work - Claude will claim to update todos but they disappear on refresh", "context": "Attempted to use built-in todo tracking during coding session", "outcome": "Switched to manual todo tracking with better results", "tags": ["claude-code", "tools", "workaround"]}
{"insight": "Claude agents perform better when given explicit thinking time in prompts", "context": "Testing different prompt structures for coding agents", "outcome": "Adding 'think step by step' improved code quality", "tags": ["prompting", "agents"]}
{"insight": "For TypeScript Claude Code plugins, use unbundled compilation to support multi-file structure with separate command files", "context": "Developing the hive-mind plugin with query and contribute commands", "outcome": "Using tsc with outDir same as source allows clean imports and modular code organization", "tags": ["claude-code", "plugins", "typescript"]}
{"insight": "Claude Code SDK types are available via @anthropic-ai/claude-code-sdk but the package is primarily for programmatic control of Claude Code, not plugin development", "context": "Setting up TypeScript types for plugin development", "outcome": "Import types directly: import type { Plugin, CommandModule } from '@anthropic-ai/claude-code-sdk'", "tags": ["claude-code", "plugins", "typescript"]}
{"insight": "JSONL format works well for community-contributed insights because it allows atomic additions without merge conflicts", "context": "Designing data format for hive-mind knowledge base", "outcome": "Contributors can append new lines without coordinating, git handles line-based merges cleanly", "tags": ["hive-mind", "data-format", "collaboration"]}
{"insight": "Keep insight entries self-contained with context and outcome fields to maintain usefulness when queried out of original order", "context": "Considering how insights will be searched and consumed", "outcome": "Each JSONL entry should tell a complete micro-story: what was tried, what happened, what was learned", "tags": ["hive-mind", "data-format"]}
</parameter>
</output>
</results>

Let me also check the session documentation to understand more context:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/docs/sessions/session-8.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<results>
<output name="Read"># Session 8: JSONL Format Deep Dive

## Summary
Finalized the data format for storing community insights in hive-mind.

## Key Decisions

### JSONL over alternatives
Considered: JSON array, SQLite, markdown files, YAML

JSONL wins because:
- **Append-only friendly** - New insights = new lines, no coordination needed
- **Git-friendly** - Line-based diffs, minimal merge conflicts
- **Streaming** - Can process large files without loading all into memory
- **Simple** - Each line is valid JSON, easy to parse in any language

### Schema design
Each line contains:
```json
{
  "insight": "The actual learning or discovery",
  "context": "What situation led to this insight",
  "outcome": "What happened when applying this knowledge",
  "tags": ["searchable", "categories"]
}
```

Design principles:
- **Self-contained** - Each entry should be useful standalone
- **Micro-story** - Context + insight + outcome tells a complete narrative
- **Searchable** - Tags enable filtering, full text enables semantic search later

### What we're NOT doing (yet)
- Timestamps - Could add if useful for freshness
- Author attribution - Privacy-friendly default, can discuss later
- Confidence scores - Keep it simple for v0.1
- Hierarchical structure - Flat is easier to contribute to

## Insights for hive-mind
Added to all-sessions.jsonl:
- JSONL format rationale for collaborative knowledge bases
- Self-contained entry design principle

<output name="Read"># project-setup

Provides guidance on when to install other plugins from the alignment-hive marketplace.

## Usage

This plugin automatically activates when Claude Code starts in a project. It adds context about available plugins and when each might be useful.

## Available Plugins

### hive-mind
**When to install:** When you want to query collective learnings from the AI safety community, or contribute insights from your sessions.

```
/plugin install hive-mind@alignment-hive
```

Now I have a good understanding of this project. Here's a summary:

---

## Project Overview: alignment-hive

**alignment-hive** is a shared infrastructure project for AI safety/alignment researchers, initially targeting MATS (ML Alignment Theory Scholars) program participants but designed for the broader AI safety community.

### Core Components

1. **Plugin Marketplace** - A curated collection of Claude Code plugins for common research workflows, distributed via the Claude Code plugin marketplace system.

2. **hive-mind** (in development) - A system for sharing session learnings across the community. The vision is to allow researchers to:
   - Query collective knowledge from other sessions
   - Contribute insights from productive sessions

### Current Plugins

1. **project-setup** (v1.0.0) - A simple markdown-based plugin that provides guidance on when to install other plugins from this marketplace.

2. **hive-mind** (v0.1.0) - A TypeScript plugin with two commands:
   - `/hive-mind-query` - Search the knowledge base (not yet implemented)
   - `/hive-mind-contribute` - Contribute session learnings (not yet implemented)

### Data Format

Insights are stored in JSONL format (`docs/sessions/all-sessions.jsonl`) with the schema:
```json
{
  "insight": "The actual learning",
  "context": "What situation led to this",
  "outcome": "What happened",
  "tags": ["searchable", "categories"]
}
```

JSONL was chosen for its append-friendly, git-friendly, and streaming-capable properties.

### Technical Stack

- TypeScript for plugin development
- Uses `@anthropic-ai/claude-code-sdk` for type definitions
- Unbundled compilation (tsc outputs to same directory as source)

### Critical Files for Implementation

- `/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/hive-mind/hive-mind.ts` - Main plugin entry point
- `/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/hive-mind/hive-mind-query.ts` - Query command (stub implementation)
- `/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/hive-mind/hive-mind-contribute.ts` - Contribute command (stub implementation)
- `/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/docs/sessions/all-sessions.jsonl` - The knowledge base data store
- `/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/docs/roadmap.md` - Project roadmap and plans
